children.subject: Yeah I think this is correct. My physical science breadth always gets updated to the latest class I've taken so it would make sense that they don't list more than 1.
My guess is that you aren't seeing both CS 162 and CS 186 as design classes on DARS because you only need one Design Class, not two. But it would still be nice to get some confirmation.

history.content: yes, thanks for letting us know. We'll get that fixed.

I'm taking CS186 and CS162 this semester, thinking about dropping CS162. I thought 162 and 186 are both design classes since

An upper-division engineering course providing a major design experience based on the knowledge and skills acquired in earlier coursework and incorporating engineering standards and realistic constraints (counts as engineering units for requirement 2). The current EECS design courses are: 

EE C125, C128, 130, 140, 141, 143, C149, 192
CS C149, 150, 160, 162, 164, 169, 184, 186 

A course in other engineering departments having substantial engineering design content can be substituted by petition.

source: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Programs/Notes/section2.shtml#2.2

However, when I check my degree audit, it shows as the following:

- IP     Design elective: one upper division course
  +     SP16 COMPSCI 162     4.0 --IP OP SYS AND SYS PROG

Note that CS186 isn't there.

I need to confirm that if CS186 is still a Design class.

Thank you.
history.subject: Is CS186 still a Design class?
